Subjective: Extreme fatigue for 2 months; waking up tired; superficial sleep; muscle pain, back pain; morning stiffness; frequent bowel movements (3-4 times/day); no clear cause or acute onset; no impact on sports (climbing); no shortness of breath or allergies; no heart palpitations or chest pain; no weight changes; no urinary issues.
Objective: BP 110/60, HR 40-60; lungs clear; spine tender at lower end; no rib tenderness; neck and shoulders mobile without pain; active bowel sounds; soft, non-tender abdomen.
Assessment: Unexplained fatigue, possible sleep disturbance; no clear signs of rheumatism or other serious conditions.
Plan: 1. Blood tests: CBC, thyroid function, inflammatory markers
2. Patient to call for telephone appointment to discuss results
3. If normal, rheumatism unlikely; monitor symptoms and follow up as needed
